title: Longyuan donates ZAR 1.03 million for purchase of pandemic supplies for Northern Cape Province in April 2020
description: In April 2020, Longyuan Limited SA donated ZAR 1.03 million to Northern Cape Province for the purchase of anti-epidemic work clothes, hand sanitizer and other anti-epidemic materials.   This investment is part of Longyuan South Africa's goal to contribute ZAR 15 million each year to the community to promote the development of the local economy around its Mulilo De Aar Wind Power Project. Other projects that Longyuan has undertaken include those related to culture, education, medical and health care, skills training, and other public welfare undertakings in the community.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Longyuan donates ZAR 1.03 million for purchase of pandemic supplies for Northern Cape Province in April 2020

# Description
In April 2020, Longyuan Limited SA donated ZAR 1.03 million to Northern Cape Province for the purchase of anti-epidemic work clothes, hand sanitizer and other anti-epidemic materials.   This investment is part of Longyuan South Africa's goal to contribute ZAR 15 million each year to the community to promote the development of the local economy around its Mulilo De Aar Wind Power Project. Other projects that Longyuan has undertaken include those related to culture, education, medical and health care, skills training, and other public welfare undertakings in the community.
justification: Project is a donation for pandemic supplies, unrelated to energy or environmental impact
evidence: Donation for anti-epidemic materials, part of community development initiatives

title: Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donates surgical masks worth ZAR 20,000 to the South African Parliament in May 2020 (linked to project ID#93586)
description: On May 13, 2020, the Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donated surgical masks worth ZAR 20,00 to the South African Parliament.  This project is the first donation of masks from the Chinese Consulate General to the South African Parliament. The second such donation occurred in October 2020 and is captured by project ID#93586.
combined_text:

HEALTH

# Description
On May 13, 2020, the Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donated surgical masks worth ZAR 20,00 to the South African Parliament.  This project is the first donation of masks from the Chinese Consulate General to the South African Parliament. The second such donation occurred in October 2020 and is captured by project ID#93586.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Surgical masks donation, healthcare sector focus

title: Longyuan donates ZAR 100,000 to Cape Town Chinese Community and Police Cooperation Center in April 2020
description: In April 2020, Longyuan Limited SA donated ZAR 100,000 to Cape Town Chinese Community and Police Cooperation Center (开普敦华人警民中心). The donation was intended to purchase protective equipment for law enforcement officers.   This investment is part of Longyuan South Africa's goal to contribute ZAR 15 million each year to the community to promote the development of the local economy around its Mulilo De Aar Wind Power Project. Other projects that Longyuan has undertaken include those related to culture, education, medical and health care, skills training, and other public welfare undertakings in the community.

title: Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donates medical equipment worth ZAR 430,000 to the Western Cape Department of Social Development in June 2020
description: On June 30, 2020, the Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donate 30,000 surgical masks, 5,000 N95 masks, 500 isolation gowns, and 500 face shields to the Western Cape Department of Social Development. The supplies were worth ZAR 430,000. The equipment was donated by Consulate General Lin Jing, and accepted by Premier Alan Winde.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donates medical equipment worth ZAR 430,000 to the Western Cape Department of Social Development in June 2020

# Description
On June 30, 2020, the Chinese Consulate General in Cape Town donate 30,000 surgical masks, 5,000 N95 masks, 500 isolation gowns, and 500 face shields to the Western Cape Department of Social Development. The supplies were worth ZAR 430,000. The equipment was donated by Consulate General Lin Jing, and accepted by Premier Alan Winde.
justification: Project involves donation of medical equipment for healthcare purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of surgical masks, N95 masks, isolation gowns, and face shields for healthcare purposes

title: Chinese Embassy in South Africa donates anti-epidemic materials to the Kglema Motlanthe Foundation in November 2020 (linked to project ID#93505)
description: On November 9, 2020, the Chinese embassy in South Africa, in conjunction with the Chinese People's Association for Friendship With Foreign Countries in South Africa donated anti-epidemic materials to the Kglema Motlanthe foundation. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  The donation occurred in a handover ceremony attended by Madame Gugu Motlanthe, wife of the former South African President and Executive Director of the Kglema Motlanthe foundation, President Motlanthe, and Chinese Ambassador Chen Xiaodong. The Chinese People's Association for Friendship With Foreign Countries' portioned of the donation is captured in project ID#93505.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

# Description
On November 9, 2020, the Chinese embassy in South Africa, in conjunction with the Chinese People's Association for Friendship With Foreign Countries in South Africa donated anti-epidemic materials to the Kglema Motlanthe foundation. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  The donation occurred in a handover ceremony attended by Madame Gugu Motlanthe, wife of the former South African President and Executive Director of the Kglema Motlanthe foundation, President Motlanthe, and Chinese Ambassador Chen Xiaodong. The Chinese People's Association for Friendship With Foreign Countries' portioned of the donation is captured in project ID#93505.

evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials, health sector focus, social development context
